website_summaries.verdict: Super Mario Odyssey is a brilliant addition to the library of Nintendo's most notable character and is an absolute must-own for anyone with a Nintendo Switch -- and a prime reason to buy one if you don't have one already.
pros: Super Mario Odyssey is a fantastic game that introduces Mario's ability to "capture" items and creatures around the world
It's filled to the brim with inventive kingdoms, superb gameplay, tons of secrets and so much more
cons: Using motion controls isn't always fun or intuitive, especially when playing on the go

customer_reviews.title: Fun for the Family
customer_reviews.text: My review is from the "father of a toddler" perspective. For those of you who have a child on the younger side, and you still enjoy Mario, don't hesitate to buy this game! My son can sit and watch this as if it is a cartoon and remains entertained the entire time. Sometimes he will say "make Mario do this" and is excited when it happens on screen. As someone who is a bit older but still enjoys games, it is a treat to find a game that entertains my son while I play.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bradford

customer_reviews.title: Just plain fun
customer_reviews.text: This is a fast-paced game with fun controls. Mario and his world look better than ever. With a move set pulled straight from Super Mario 64 (with a few delightful twists and additions), traveling from kingdom to kingdom is a joy both aesthetically and functionally. Play at your pace and explore to no end. I had high expectations, and it’s still blowing me away. 5 stars for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Ky Burton

customer_reviews.title: A MUST own title for the Nintendo Switch
customer_reviews.text: This game oozes charm, and creativity. It's the game that I believe makes a true sequel to Mario 64. The worlds are so bright and colorful. Theres so many skins to choose from, and they even added balloon world which spices it up some more in terms of more content. I collected everything in each world, and it did not feel like a chore. Personally, I would love to 100% complete this game. Meaning, that I would love to collect all the skins. You would have to collect a lot of coin, and that's hard for me to do at this point since I'm busy with other things. Seriously though, this game is magical.
customer_reviews.author: Spirit

customer_reviews.title: The Hits Keep Comin'
customer_reviews.text: Now celebrating his 35th anniversary with the 3D All Stars Collection on Switch, Super Mario Odyssey became the perfect platform to push off the wonderful new hybrid handheld console. As far as 3D Mario games go I feel like they've mostly improved since their establishment on the N64, which makes Odyssey a crown jewel for a system that just continues to rack up fantastic first party titles.
customer_reviews.author: JulianTop Contributor: James Bond

customer_reviews.title: Mario at his greatest.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a huge Zelda fan and was kind of disappointed by Breath of the Wild since it just didn't have that magic most Zelda games have. Even though I played 210 hours of it I wasn't really having fun, it felt more like a chore to play. For the first time ever a Mario game has been way more fun to play than Zelda. I've only played Odyssey for 65 hours but those have all been really enjoyable. I always want to go back to find more moons and take more photos of the scenery.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan R

customer_reviews.title: Old School entertainment, awesome, rad, sweet...
customer_reviews.text: Like Zelda (Breath of the "Awesome") I feel like I enjoy playing Videoo Games again... Its fresh, fun... Doesn't feel like work... Mario Odyssey is an escape back to my childhood... Thanks Nintendo for remaining different and friendly... At my age I can't keep up with the tweakers and such, I enjoy gaming again... Can't wait for Metroid.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan S

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the most fun games out there for the switch. The levels have so many different dynamics and some are super easy and some are way harder. Definitely love how they bring the old Mario into the game as well with hidden pixel levels. So awesome! It is a 2 player but the second person plays as your hat so it’s not as exciting for them.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Budge-Heaslet

customer_reviews.title: It is a MUST HAVE! Why haven't you bought it yet?
customer_reviews.text: Simply another FANTASTIC game created by the DISNEY of video games, Nintendo. If you played Super Mario 64, Super Mario Sunshine, Super Mario Galaxy 1 and 2, then you are in for a thrill of a lifetime. If this is your first ever Mario game, then holy cow man you are going to have your eyes opened like never before. Great graphics, great gameplay, great story, great, great, great. Your kids will love it. Your wife/husband will love it. Your dog will love it if he/she can play. I am that serious. Very easy game too, so kids should not have any problems completing the game and babies will have an challenging entertaining game.
customer_reviews.author: The-Only-Pupo

customer_reviews.title: One of the best most feel good experiences I've had in years
customer_reviews.text: One of the best most feel good experiences I've had in years! I picked up this game at launch and it helped me deal with a loss in the family by cheering me up when I needed it most. The worlds are so colorful, the music is great, the game has so much style and just makes you feel good. I am also enjoying watching my daughter play the game, learning slowly to get through levels and having fun with it.
customer_reviews.author: KikiMochy

customer_reviews.title: Not 8-Bit Mario, but still a blast.
customer_reviews.text: This game is great. Not your old school Mario, much more open world, but a lot of fun. The game play is clever utilizing Cappy the hat to assist and do most functions, yet somehow it maintains the Mario charm. Cappy is somewhat like a Yoshi that can't run away. Though unlike Yoshi, you have to have Cappy for a lot of things in the game. The combat style is fun and inventive with spinning and twirling remotes and being able to become frogs and dinosaurs. I do really enjoy this game. My one criticism is the repetitiveness of the game. It does after several hours feel a bit like you have done the same thing over and over again.
customer_reviews.author: Ilostmysanity

customer_reviews.title: New Age, Nostalgia, Perfection, Overload!
customer_reviews.text: After owning nintendo switch for over 2 years and playing the best of (hands down, breath of the wild) I finally bought Odyssey and all of the 5 star comments were dead on! One of the best Mario's I've played since super mario world (at 9 years old) then mario 64 (12 years old) now at 34, super mario odyssey still stands the nostalgic test of time and lives up to all of the hype!! Thanks for all the continued memories nintendo!
customer_reviews.author: Never Wrong

customer_reviews.title: Best mario game!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best mario games available. The graphics are really crisp and detailed although from a distance you can see how the clarity dips. The game runs at 60 frames per second and it makes a big difference. The story is very satisfying nothing complicated but just fun. The levels and the variety of power moons to collect is just ludicrous there is so much to do in the game, it will keep you busy for months. Overall a very fun game for the family.
customer_reviews.author: RVDZ25

customer_reviews.title: Super fun and clever new Mario world to explore!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE the new Mario odyssey game!! We got this for Christmas, and to have to play in anticipation of our coming newborn in a month, and being stuck indoors for a bit (in addition to just being really excited about the new Nintendo console!). Nintendo has done an amazing job of creating a robust new world to explore. We really like how they incorporated some of the throwback bit graphics into the 3 dimensional world as well. We have just gotten started checking it all out, but really enjoying it so far. It will definitely give us plenty of hours of entertainment in the upcoming months.
customer_reviews.author: ChezLars

customer_reviews.title: Greatest 3D Mario of all-time
customer_reviews.text: Its easy to say about the "latest and greatest" but really, when only compared to the previous game, Super Mario 3D World, right away you notice the visuals and gameplay is leaps and bounds superior. The hat mechanic is great, the motion controls do feel gimmicky (unlike splatoon 2) and I prefer the standard set up. This is easily game of the year contender competing against its family member, Zelda BOTW. Super Mario Odyssey is a must have game for the Switch to cap off Nintendo's greatest launch year in its history.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Loved it!
customer_reviews.text: The kids love it.original switch game. Only issue we had is game is no longer available to get gold coin credits through nintendo.which is no ones fault but nintendo's.apearently once a game reaches a year after its release, game it is no longer available for those gold coins. So basically majority of the games on the market. Came sealed and brand new.the kids love it!!! I give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Merrill

customer_reviews.title: Fun but too easy
customer_reviews.text: Super Mario Odyssey is fun, but it’s very easy to beat... once beaten, it will create additional “moons” (equivalent of stars), but they are - in general - very easy to find as well. Overall, I recommended buying because while it lasted, it was worth $60
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Mario Odyssey is the Best Mario
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS MARIO!! MARIO!!!! I purchase the Nintendo Switch in July with Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild. It is one of the best games I have ever played. Well, ever since the announcement of Super Mario Odyssey, I have been anxious to purchase it. I pre-ordered a copy the week before launch. It has not been a let down. It's been hard for me to put down the game. Nintendo deserves all they have done this year. Super Mario Sunshine for the GameCube used to be my favorite Mario I've played, but now Mario Odyssey may have changed my mind.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter Mayberry

customer_reviews.title: A true successor to Super Mario 64
customer_reviews.text: Super Mario Odyssey is the first real Mario game I have played in a long time, but I really enjoyed every bit of the experience and will play it many more times. The capture mechanic is by far the coolest feature in a Mario game to date and the story is filled with lush environments, cool characters, and lots to do. After playing this game I really want to go and try Super Mario Galaxy and Galaxy 2, but I might wait for the Virtual Console to appear on the Switch first. Nintendo has been on a roll with these 60FPS masterpieces so here's hoping they can continue!
customer_reviews.author: Metragoon

customer_reviews.title: Must have Mario!
customer_reviews.text: Wow. Where to begin. I was hesitant about buying this game. I am very traditional in my gaming tastes but this is the best Mario in a very, very long time. It is challenging and you can either beat the levels or try and fully complete the little challenges in all of them. This is the kind of game that even when you beat it you can play it over and over and it is still fun. That is a concept that used to be a norm in Nintendo games but has been somewhat lost over the years. You will love this game, it is amazing. Nintendo is really turning things around!
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids, but not for adults
customer_reviews.text: I bought this game expecting a challenge, similar to mario 64 or super mario sunshine, or even galaxy, but the majority of this game is simple and seems to be aimed towards younger audiences. If I were 10, and not 25, this game would be a blast, but as a grown man seeking a challenge I can't say I love it.
customer_reviews.author: sherry

customer_reviews.title: Super Mario 64 meets Super Mario 3D World
customer_reviews.text: I grew up playing Super Mario 64 for the N64 and it was my all time favorite Mario game. Playing this game now in 2017 feels too good to be true in an era of triple A titles filled with loot boxes and other microtransactions. None of that garbage exists here. Even the amiibo functionality is completely optional with all costumes being unlockable also by just playing the game. This game is just as good as Zelda Breath of the Wild in the sense that it creates a memorable experience that we will remember for YEARS to come
customer_reviews.author: Linkman123

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Game, New Favorite 3D Mario
customer_reviews.text: For a long time I favored Mario Sunshine for the vast worlds and such diverse ways to play. Now, after many years, Mario Odyssey has taken the top. This game is stellar, from the easy controls to the vast range of puzzles, games, and exploration. It's simple enough for children to play, but complex enough to entertain adults like me. It even has some absurdly challenging parts just for those who love to torture themselves for 100% completion. I've been nothing but happy with this game, and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Amazing game! One of the best Mario games ever!
customer_reviews.text: Since Zelda: Breath of the Wild came out I was anxiously waiting for this game. This was one of my main reasons for buying a Switch. I've always loved Mario since my first time playing Super Mario Bros on NES. I haven't had a game that made me so happy to play in a while. Becoming a T-Rex and having the ability to roar and crash through stone walls in a Mario game feels like a fever dream I would have had when I was a kid after playing some Mario and watching Jurassic Park. Don't even question getting this game if you have the ability to. Just do it!
customer_reviews.author: Colin G.

customer_reviews.title: Might be my favorite 3D Mario.
customer_reviews.text: It took watching a videogamedunkey video to crystalize why I love this game so much. It's a collect-a-thon! It's not like previous Mario games where you had a task to get a star and the whole experience was tailored to that task until you did it. This game is about exploring the environments, finding nooks and crannies, and being rewarded for your time incremenetally. It feels great to control and the possession mechanic is ace. The 2D sections feel a little sticky, as does jumping off poles, but those are minor quibbles.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Roth

customer_reviews.title: Super Mario at His Best!
customer_reviews.text: Nintendo does it again with this masterpiece. From classic 2D level design to the 3D that caputured our hearts in Mario 64, this game truly is a joy to play. It's quirky, lovable, colorful, and fun. Great for all ages and not to hard for the casual gamer (assured by the girlfriend). Oddessy and Zelda are two of the best games that I've played in years. I implore you to get lost in the same magic that Nintendo has been using to dazzle us since the early 80s. 5/5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle D.

customer_reviews.title: Gaming Perfection
customer_reviews.text: Easily the best 3D Mario game to date. Not too hard, but also not too easy. It has the perfect amount of challenge for gamers of all skill levels. Each world is crafted wonderfully and beautifully. I couldn't put the game down, like a good book, I just needed to keep going to see what amazing world, and puzzle, and enemy I would come across next. Couldn't recommend this enough for anyone and everyone. I never expected this, but there's even free content updates coming, which makes it even more amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Nathanial Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Super Mario Odyssey on the Nintendo Switch
customer_reviews.text: Super Mario Odyssey on the Nintendo Switch! Nintendo has amazed once again! Purchased the console last week, had to make sure I purchased the Mario. I already knew my kids would love the challenge! Now pay it mind, my kids have their own PS4's, which they play games intended for the older audiences. Well delivered this past Monday, and the kids have not put the controllers down. As always Mario is filled with different levels, that gives a new meaning to the word strategy! The levels are filled with excitement all while challenging. Graphics are great and I just want to say Mario Odessey is an all around great game. So, 2 thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Nick P.

customer_reviews.title: Remarkable
customer_reviews.text: Nintendo does it again, a fantastic work of art. Mario Odyssey proves why this is Nintendo franchise mascot. Levels, game play, creativity are all top notch. I will say this though. Odyssey very much mimics Mario 64 than say Mario Galaxy. What I mean is both M64 and Odyssey feel more like exploration platformers then say Mario Galaxy, where that series felt 100% of pure platforming.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Super fun and challenging but not frustrating
customer_reviews.text: Mario is Nintendo's flagship character and his games are rarely misses. This game is exceptional though. The switches features are already great but when coupled with a solid game like this, it is easy to fall deeper in love. Fans of Super Mario 64 and Mario Sunshine will be especially happy with this game. It is fun and difficult but not frustratingly so. I really got the feeling while playing the game that it wanted me to win but wasn't going to just hand it to me. I liked the collection/decoration aspect, the costume effects, and the secrets scattered around the world.
customer_reviews.author: KrisKrisKris

customer_reviews.title: MARIO 4 LIFE
customer_reviews.text: This game is amazing. One of the best modern Mario games out there. Such amazing mechanics and details and not to mention the replayability! There's always more things to do! I have beat the game twice and still keep going back to get hidden items and explore more places. It's not too difficult of a play-through either which is great for all ages. It's a good game to chill out and play. If you're a Mario fan you will love all the easter eggs to past games as well. Buy it for yourself, your cousins, your mom and your dog, they'll all love it.
customer_reviews.author: noah brown

customer_reviews.title: Family friendly game with amazing game play
customer_reviews.text: Easily one of the greatest entries in the Mario franchise. Its up there with the Wii U Mario, Mario 64 and Super Mario Bros 3 as all time greats. This is a prime example of why Nintendo always thrives. The game play is smooth with no glitches that I have ran into, the controls work flawlessly and they graphics are amazing and smooth. It's nice to put in a game and play that works 100% without having patches for months trying to fix issues that should have been before release. You never realize how important that is until you get a great game that just plain works!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lowey

customer_reviews.title: Dirty game wouldn't work until I cleaned it...
customer_reviews.text: 3 stars because when I received the game, it did not work at all. I requested a return then figured let me have a look at the game one more time before boxing it up. I noticed some crust (of idk what) on the back of the game where the switch would read the information. I had to scrape the crust off the back of the game before it would even play in my switch. You'd think they would make sure the game played properly before sending it out. It works now that I cleaned it so I cancelled the return and will be keeping the game.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Frank

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I am not really a Mario fan by any means. I mean, he is cool and everything but I haven’t played all the games. I am not a diehard Nintendo player either. I generally enjoy more mature games. That said, I have enjoyed this game a lot. I still believe Zelda: Breath of the Wild is the best game for Switch but adding Mario Odyssey to the Switch game line up is like having another gem on a diamond ring. It is still great. Good job Nintendo. Keep it up with the Switch.
customer_reviews.author: Weeble Wobble

customer_reviews.title: Fun game, but TOO MANY MOONS!
customer_reviews.text: This game is amazing. The movement is fluid, the levels are beautiful and unique, and the game itself is fairly challenging. However, I found myself running out of steam trying to collect all 999 power moons. Yes, that's right, there's almost 1000 power moons to collect. The entire game feels bloated with the sheer unnecessary amount of the moons. Here's hoping the sequel tones down on the collectible and makes them more substantial.
customer_reviews.author: Pumpkinpoy

customer_reviews.title: Nintendo, another great game for the record books.
customer_reviews.text: Reminds me of Super Mario 64! As a 26 year old who doesn't have time to sit and play as many video games as I would like to, this game allows me to be a kid again. The stunning graphics messed together with beautiful game play is something that I can sit and play for hours. There is still quite the challenge with many of the worlds and I have spent countless hours trying to find the last moon on many levels. Thank you Nintendo for making me feel like a kid again.
customer_reviews.author: Thor_King

customer_reviews.title: Hands down one of the best games out there..
customer_reviews.text: Super Mario Odysseys hands down one of the best games out there right now. I love the fact how you can jump into the game in single player mode or you can jump into the game in two player mode and have a friend of yours assist you by taking control of the character copy and the other person controls Mario. Besides that I love the way the game looks so vibrant and colorful the controls are pretty easy to games not hard to get the hang of it and I like how there's a lot of objectives. I recommend this game to anybody who is a Mario fan and is an avid gamer who enjoys the new experiences.
customer_reviews.author: Xavier Matos

customer_reviews.title: A perfect game in every way
customer_reviews.text: I grew up playing Mario games and I’m happy to say that 30+ years later, Nintendo hasn’t lost their ability to make a truly great Mario game. The level design is on another level! Each one is truly unique and so creative. They even found a clever way to incorporate 8bit Mario games into this new title. Nintendo has found a way to make their company “mascot” and flagship title both familiar and new at the same time. This is hands down the best Mario game in years.
customer_reviews.author: SilverGameDog

customer_reviews.title: This game is trully amazing and anyone who enjoys Mario games and has a ...
customer_reviews.text: This game is trully amazing and anyone who enjoys Mario games and has a switch would be crazy to pass this up. I got a lot of time and enjoyment out of this game and I haven't even completely finished it. There is so much to do and it's all so creative and different so you rarely get bored. The graphics are fantastic and it's always fun to be able to take a full 3D Mario game with you on the go. The story is very traditionally Mario and you won't be too surprised but it's still an amazing journey to go on and worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: MissBlinou

customer_reviews.title: It's Good.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know If I'm being nostalgic, but Odyssey if I'm being honest seems like it's missing something. It's a really good game though. I beat the "main" story pretty quickly, and beat the dark side. I'm working on getting enough moons on the darker side, but grinding for moons gets a little boring, which is weird because I can grind for stuff in BOTW and waste hours and not realize it. I have to take a break from Odyssey after an hour most of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Old and new meets with SO many bonuses!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this game for my little girl, thinking she would enjoy it, as we are huge fans of all the old mario games. The game is amazing, there are so many adventures you can go on, you can even be a dinosaur for a short bit, how cool right?, and the graphics are fin and full of color. You can warp to the 2d mario, like old times, in parts of the game. Would highly recommend for you to buy as it is so much fun to play and to watch!
customer_reviews.author: JTB420

customer_reviews.title: Fun game as every Mario game
customer_reviews.text: Gave this as Christmas gift for my nephews (from me, my wife, father, mother and brother) together with a brand new Nintendo Switch and my nephews couldn’t love it more. I actually played with them on New Years and boy, this game got me crazy. I didn’t want to let them play 🤣. It’s very fun, intuitive, with lots and lots of features and different missions to accomplish. I would recommend this game to any kid, and even to anybody that has played any Mario game in the past. You will not regret.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel J. Peguero

customer_reviews.title: Best Nintendo game in 20 years.
customer_reviews.text: This game has more polish than Zelda. This is THE definitive Switch game. Fantastic. Everything is fine tuned.
customer_reviews.author: T. Marble

customer_reviews.title: Yes. Just give Nintendo your money.
customer_reviews.text: I just wanted everyone to know it's a 5 star game. It's fun - it's creative, I mean, it's maybe the best Mario game. It's Mario Sunshine meets Mario Galaxy. I'm not an advanced player and was able to beat like 98% of the game and I think if you're a very good video game player, this game still provides a challenge. Kids will love the game and changing all the outfits. Parents will love it because they'll get asked 100 times to "beat this part for me." Anyway, hats off to you Nintendo (see what I did there).
customer_reviews.author: pinapino

customer_reviews.title: Reminds me of Super Mario 64
customer_reviews.text: The game is an open world game much like the classic N64 Super Mario. Its fun and challenging all the same. It has an option for assisted play for beginning players that need a bit of guidance throughout the game. It is semi-two player as you can have a second player control Mario’s hat. Overall I enjoy the game and reminiscing playing N64.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco J Vazquez

customer_reviews.title: Can't deny I'm having fun :)
customer_reviews.text: Omg I think I get more frustrated with Mario jumping to the opposite side of a wall I want to climb but that's on me I know haha. (my wife also hear me complain more with dying than when I was plying Assassins Creed Origins). Good game, following a similar basis than all he others with of course, new gameplay added. I didn't thought I would get very hooked to it since this is not the kind of games I play at 39, but, it has been very entertaining.
customer_reviews.author: Gerardo A. Mora

customer_reviews.title: A masterpiece!
customer_reviews.text: This is the pinnacle of all Mario games. You can tell right from the start how much love and attention to detail was put into this game. Every where you turn there is a nod to familiar Mario titles. The puzzles are fun and rarey repetative. This is a wonderful game for new gamers to aged veterans like myself. Theres far more content that I originally thought. The game opens up more and more as you play. This is a must buy for any Switch owner.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Ronde

customer_reviews.title: We LOVE playing this game
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE playing this game! After the first couple lands, it became a little too difficult for our 5 year old but he LOVES watching us play so it's a win win! Parents and Children Approved! In fact, one of my favorite things is that it's almost intended for you to play this game with a friend. When it's set to 2 players, the second (or first--you choose) player gets to control Cappy and do extra cool stuff!
customer_reviews.author: MomofBoys

customer_reviews.title: 5/5 what else can you expect from a mario game
customer_reviews.text: I'm only on the 3rd world but I'm already loving it! Super colorful and fun to play. They included small parts of the game that goes Into the 2D mario view which is super cool and a huge throwback to the original mario games. Some people claim it to be easy, but there are times where I have died a few times in a row but I think it's just my fault for trying to rush. If you have a nintendo switch, this game is a must have :)
customer_reviews.author: E. Mendez

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Mario Game
customer_reviews.text: As I am getting older (52 this year) I am looking for more games to play that are enjoyable and challanging but not frustrating. This is definitely one of those games. This is the Best Mario game that has come out in years. I am enjoying the story and exploring the new lands. One of the Best games this years and one of the best Mario Games since the Mario Galaxy series. If you have a switch this is a must buy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bigbman65

customer_reviews.title: One of The Best Games Ever. Seriously.
customer_reviews.text: If you have a Nintendo Switch, BUY THIS GAME! This is one of the best games I have ever played and may be the best Mario game ever created (toss up between this and 64). This is an essential game to have if you have a switch and if you don't have a switch but plan on getting one make sure you purchase this. This can be purchased for a child or an adult, it's great for anyone of any age. Seriously, just buy it and see for yourself. And no, Nintendo isn't paying me for this, it's just that good.
customer_reviews.author: Keagan

customer_reviews.title: Great Variation of Mario
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a gift, but it’s a fun Mario variation with a one player and two player co-op mode. Gameplay can be fairly technical though, so I wouldn’t necessarily recommend it for younger kids (I know I would have gotten confused and frustrated really quick when I was a kid)
customer_reviews.author: Phil G

customer_reviews.title: The Killer App for Nintendo Switch
customer_reviews.text: This game is the end-all, be-all reason to own a Switch right now. I picked mine up earlier this year and have thoroughly enjoyed it, but most games were ports that could be played on the Wii U. This game is 3d Mario at its finest. The graphics are beautiful, and the gameplay is fun and engaging. The controls are everything you'd expect from a 3d Mario game like 64, Sunshine, or Galaxy: responsive and add to the game, rather than detract. There's so much to do once the main story is complete, with 800 or so moons to collect. Can't recommend enough, 10/10.
customer_reviews.author: Tony R

customer_reviews.title: It's a me!
customer_reviews.text: I thought this game was going to be ok just another Mario game and boy I was wrong! The game is great, it is different from any Mario before it but keeps the basic mechanisms to be a "Mario" (platformer) game. There are a LOT of moons that you have to discover in every different place and at least for me is a challenge and kind of addictive to look for as many as I can. You can pass any world in like 15 minutes if you want but that is not the fun of the game. There is a lot to be discovered and Nintendo just hit it out of the park....again!
customer_reviews.author: El boricua

customer_reviews.title: Second Only to Mario 64
customer_reviews.text: The best game on the Switch currently. You don't need testimony but here - I got my NES in 1988 with Super Mario Bros/Duck Hunt, I have been playing Mario through every generation since and this is the 2nd best Mario game created, aside from Mario 64 which my nostalgia is holding at #1. Go watch a few videos on Nintendos website or a video review. Or just buy it. Mario is ubiquitous with FUN!
customer_reviews.author: Ross

customer_reviews.title: Thank you Nintendo
customer_reviews.text: Absurdly fun and addicting to play. I haven't been this involved in a Mario game since Super Mario 64 and Super Mario World for SNES. A true treat for older and younger audiences alike. Huge shout-out to the creators and minds behind this gem. Thank you for not only bringing back a slice of my youth, but for updating it in a fashion I never deemed possible. 8-bit and HD Mario in one package? Crazy.
customer_reviews.author: CT

customer_reviews.title: This game is a lot of fun to play
customer_reviews.text: This game is a lot of fun to play. A lot of other games are good but not necessarily fun. This one is fun nonstop. Some complaints: there are frustrating issues with the controls being a little loose. Like I press two buttons at the same time to do a special move but it acts as if I only pressed one of them. This is most frustrating in a timed challenge because you have to start over. Also, there are a couple of challenges (look up: the jump rope challenge) that are just ridiculously difficult and not worth the time and effort.
customer_reviews.author: balshetzer

customer_reviews.title: Just simply incredible!
customer_reviews.text: This will go down in history as one of the greatest games of all time. Nintendo has been on fire this year, and they knocked it out of the park yet again! Just like Super Mario Bros (1985) and Super Mario 64 (1996) forever changed and solidified the landscape of platformer games, this joins the ranks of that same honor for the modern day of video game platformers.
customer_reviews.author: zakster90

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: An amazing game that is the true successor to Super Mario 64. Mario 64 is pretty dated nowadays but at the time was something truly revolutionary back in 1996. Over 20 years later I finally got the same feeling that I had on Christmas Day all those years ago. Amazing graphics, great sound, and gameplay that is impeccable. This is THE killer app for the Switch and everyone needs to play it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: This is hands down one of the best Mario games ever made
customer_reviews.text: This is hands down one of the best Mario games ever made. The game is easy to pick up and fun to play! If you ignore finding all of the collectibles in the game, it takes about 12 hours to beat. If you are a completionist player, you can expect to be logging at least 40 hours. I would strongly recommend this game to all. It is welcoming enough to the casual player, but still offers robust gameplay and a compelling story to keep even the most serious gamers entertained.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much a must-have game
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much a must-have game. There is a ton of stuff to find and explore. I initially felt the game was a bit too easy. But thalf of the game's content is unlocked after playing through the main story, and that's where the more challenging stuff is. The game is only as hard as you want it to be because so much of it is optional.
customer_reviews.author: Darren

customer_reviews.title: Fun for everyone
customer_reviews.text: Great game so far! Nintendo is on a roll with games for their switch console. Very enjoyable play experience with great graphics and the ability to play on the go with the switch makes it even better! There is even a two player mode that allows one person to control Mario and the other to control the hat. This is great if you have a friend to play with so you don't have to take turns..
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: Renewed my love for gaming!
customer_reviews.text: This game seriously deserves a 5 star review. I haven't enjoyed a game and lost track of time as easily as I do in this game in so long! Being 25, i did grow up on the 64 port of Mario and the throwback feel + many more welcomed elements truly make this an instant classic. While waiting for my delivery however, I did read up on a few of the negative reviews and a common trend for whatever reason is the frustration of motion controls. Don't let that deter you haha those people are somehow incapable of turning off motion controls in the option menu.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Top 5 game of 2017 and one off the greatest games of al
customer_reviews.text: Top 5 game of 2017 and one off the greatest games of al, time. Mario and Nintendo keep reinventing themselves time and time again. There was s s much to do in this game. Coins and moons to find will give you endless hours of fun. The game can be challenging in spots but is welcoming to gamers of any age. This game has so much heart, there isn’t much to not love.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic game with clever mechanics, great fun for big and small
customer_reviews.text: It's a long way from the classic jump & run Mario from the good old days, quite complicated yet clever mechanics, it's great fun as a single or 2 players. It doesn't get boring, there is always something new to discover and keeps you repeating levels looking for hidden moons. This is a must have game on the Switch. In my opinion there is just 1 game better than Mario... Zelda Breath of the Wild.
customer_reviews.author: Noel L.

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Not a Mario fan. I’ve played and enjoyed platformers before, but this one wasn’t for me. I didn’t enjoy the fact that the game wants you to play with detached Joy-Cons. The story is typical Mario - kidnapped princess must be rescued by mustachioed plumber.
customer_reviews.author: The Guy on the Couch

customer_reviews.title: Charming For The First Timer or The Veteran
customer_reviews.text: I have been a gamer all my life, yet I have never played a Mario game. This is enjoyable without being frustrating. It's not too hard and not too easy. Even then, if you want a challenge, there are levels in the game that will challenge those looking for more difficulty. I'm already hooked.
customer_reviews.author: Bianca

customer_reviews.title: MASTERPIECE!!! THANK YOU NINTENDO!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the reason why I bought a Nintendo Switch. This is a beautiful game!!! This game brings a smile to my face everytime I play. Nintendo is the king of video games and Odyssey is a MUST OWN!! LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Solosmooth

customer_reviews.title: Worth buying a Switch for.
customer_reviews.text: Probably one of the best Mario games around. Galaxy and N64 were definite contenders for solid play. Sunshine for insanity and level design. Odyssey fits an in-between where the game FEELS good and the controls are not only responsive, but also crisp and can be creatively mixed/matched for very deft maneuvering. Hard to describe all of it without spoiling the game over, but there are incredible throwbacks, internal references to other legacy Nintendo titles (all the way back to original DK!), and a self-awareness that is satisfying.
customer_reviews.author: 600Gillaspie

customer_reviews.title: Fun game
customer_reviews.text: A great game with lots to do. This game will provide you with hours of fun. The game is easy to play in tablet mode or when docked. When you play in tablet mode it's best to use a stand or the build in kick stand to you can use tie joy cons separately. The graphics are what you would expect for a Switch game. Overall a really fun game to play.
customer_reviews.author: David Fattal

customer_reviews.title: Overhyped
customer_reviews.text: This game is so overhyped. I played this game for exactly 17 hours and haven’t played it since. There has to be a reason why that happened. I was expecting it to knock my socks off, since games like Super Mario Galaxy was so revolutionary, but this... Pretty visuals aren’t everything, I’ll leave it at that.
customer_reviews.author: Melody Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Pure fun. A must own for anyone with a Switch.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had this much straight up fun playing a video game in a long time. I actually played this game to 100% completion (999 moons and all costumes) and I enjoyed every bit of it. Even the really challenging parts don't feel unfair and finally building up the skill to beat them feels very rewarding. This is honestly the closest I've felt to being a kid in a long, long time. Nintendo has done a phenomenal job with this game.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super Mario Odyssey a big hit with the grandchildren!
customer_reviews.text: As the "Best Gigi Ever" at Christmas, I am glad I knew to purchase a game along with the Nintendo Switch as it did not come with one. From the Grands' reaction while playing the game, I have decided that it must be a fun game. It's very hard to get their attention when I am competing with Super Mario Odyssey for the Nintendo Switch!
customer_reviews.author: Retro Patty

customer_reviews.title: Nintendo does it again.
customer_reviews.text: One of the most enjoyable games of the decade. Pure joy at every corner, with deep controls that are not hard to understand. Some of the most creative level design and worlds to date in the Mario franchise. The possession mechanic with the hat is so unbelievably enjoyable, I'm surprised it took this long to be in a game. Co-Op mode is not very fun. If you have a Switch, you should own this game.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Hoganson

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic game. I'm almost 40 and I spend hours ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic game. I'm almost 40 and I spend hours on this game like I did with Super Mario World and Super Mario 64. The last time I was so engrossed into a game was Zelda Ocarina of Time. While I don't play 14 hours straight like I did with Zelda, I do play Mario every night as bonding time with my kids who like to watch Mario celebrate catching moons.
customer_reviews.author: A09

customer_reviews.title: Amazing game.
customer_reviews.text: It's Super Mario Odyssey. Not much more to say.I played through the main game (not getting extra moons, etc.) in about a week. That's not because there was no challenge. It's because I was just playing that much. This game stole my weekend.
customer_reviews.author: 8-Bit Jay

customer_reviews.title: Top Notch Mario Game
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing. This is probably my favorite Mario game and I definitely think it's the best game for the Switch (I am not big into Zelda, so Breath of the Wild did nothing for me). I hadn't been this excited for a Mario game since Super Mario 64. Nintendo really knows how to tug at your heartstrings when it comes to nostalgia. I definitely recommend this game to anyone who's been following every Mario game.
customer_reviews.author: Crindee

customer_reviews.title: It is that good
customer_reviews.text: Like most people I was disappointed when the game suggested to detach the joycons for extra moves. I never play my Switch docked, I play on the go and in bed. I also think that the game is way too easy. On the other hand, there are really cool things, I love the 2d parts and some stages have some really cool stuff. Buy it of course, it will be great fun.
customer_reviews.author: Andres V

customer_reviews.title: Easy Story Completion with fun Challenges here and there.
customer_reviews.text: Its a Mario Game. If you liked super Mario Sunshine and Super Mario 64 you will probably like this. 4 Stars for too easy at times. I debated giving it 5 stars because it tries to make easy advancement in the game but it is still difficult at times. For example you can re-fight the dragon at a higher difficulty after the main story is beaten just for the challenge. So the game provides a challenge for those who are core fans.
customer_reviews.author: Joe D.

customer_reviews.title: It’s no zelda but it’s a REALLY Good Mario game
customer_reviews.text: Phenomenal game. Not only Have I only heard great about this game but I am also saying that it’s great. My only true complaint atm (about 6 hours in) I wish Mario still did his punch punch kick. It’s been replaced 100% with her attacks but I still love it. This game environments are great and I’ve been eager to get every last collectible within them
customer_reviews.author: Zx10

customer_reviews.title: Great way to game with kids
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy this game a lot - it is a little complicated at first because the multi-player mode requires a lot of strategy and communication between the in-person players, otherwise you'll lose levels quickly!
customer_reviews.author: Tab Stout

customer_reviews.title: My favorite title for the Nintendo switch thus far
customer_reviews.text: My favorite title for the Nintendo switch thus far. I never took the time to play completely through some of the older mario games (Sunshine, Galaxy, etc) and I still found this game incredibly fun. Very well polished, keeps your attention through the mini tasks to get moons (which there are more of than stars/shines in previous games), and has plenty of retro throwbacks through minigames in the various kingdoms.
customer_reviews.author: Mister Locations

customer_reviews.title: Great odyssey!!!
customer_reviews.text: This game is amazing. In a way this game is sort of a celebration of Mario. There are so many Easter eggs of other Mario games in this game. There are a lot of times that it made nostalgic for previous games. It is also a blast and challenge to collect all the power moons. So will be frustrating to get but that's the charm of it. I recommend this game to anyone really. You cant go wrong at all with this game.
customer_reviews.author: AR. M

customer_reviews.title: Such a fun addition to the Mario universe
customer_reviews.text: Such a fun addition to the Mario universe! Was a little weary and confused by the whole hat thing at first, but once you get the hang of it, it's so fun! So far I have only played with the JoyCons on the device for portability, but there are lots of movements that the controllers can do when docked, or using without the JoyCons attached. Definitely worth the buy!
customer_reviews.author: dad

customer_reviews.title: Let's-a-go!
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift and the recipient loves it. An amazing game with so much to do - a cool step up / evolution to the Mario series with quirky humor and jabs and Bowser in a tux - just perfection. Pays great homage to the Mario games of old while spicing it up and keeping you on your toes with cool worlds to explore. No Mario fan should be without this game!
customer_reviews.author: Tammi M

customer_reviews.title: I liked this game this game includes 17 levels 1 cap ...
customer_reviews.text: I liked this game this game includes 17 levels 1 cap kingdom 2 cascade kingdom 3 sand kingdom 4 wooded kingdom 5 lake kingdom 6 cloud kingdom 7lost kingdom 8 metro kingdom 9 snow kingdom 10 seaside kingdom 11food kingdom 12 sad kingdom 13 browser kingdom 13 moon 14 dark moon 15 castle
customer_reviews.author: valentin flores

customer_reviews.title: this game is brilliant. Having grown up playing Super Mario/Yoshi's Island on ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the first game I acquired for my Switch and I have to say: this game is brilliant. Having grown up playing Super Mario/Yoshi's Island on the classic consoles, I thoroughly enjoyed the brief throwbacks to the classic styles! I have put in around 20 hours so far, taking my time to explore and collect moons. The visuals are fun, the gameplay is fun, it's just a FUN game! A+
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Another amazingly fun Mario game!
customer_reviews.text: Nintendo never disappoints with their core Mario games. This is no different. Just a ton of great adventure, power moon hunting and obstacles to figure out. I hadn't played a Mario game is quite some time, and this is a great return to the franchise for me. So glad I purchased this game. I can't stop playing it!
customer_reviews.author: Roy T

customer_reviews.title: Different Then It Used To Be
customer_reviews.text: I used to love Mario games but this one has a completley different feel and wasn't the same game. It was okay and decent to play but gets kind of boring and I just can't play too long.
customer_reviews.author: Alice Ceballos

customer_reviews.title: Enjoyment for every member of the family
customer_reviews.text: Our family gets hours of enjoyment out of this game. I grew up with Super Mario Brothers and the evolution of the game is stunning. It's hard enough to challenge the gamer who enjoyed all of the Mario branded games like myself but easy enough for kids who are just getting into video games to enjoy and complete some objectives in the game also known as "Power Moons."
customer_reviews.author: KC W

customer_reviews.title: best switch game hands down
customer_reviews.text: So many hours of gameplay. So much cool stuff. By the time I found the t-rex in the forest I was sold on it. By the time I reached the moon I was like this is my favorite game. My hands actually got a little sore from playing on a few occasions, but I can't knock that, especially because it recommends playing with the controllers detached and I kept them on (it's totally playable that way so I assume it's just for comfort reasons) and also because that was from literal hours of playing. This is def the best game on the Switch, I'm technically an adult and I love it but kids would be geeked on it too.
customer_reviews.author: Sophia Gyarmathy

customer_reviews.title: Best game i have played in a LONG time
customer_reviews.text: Best game i have played in a LONG time. Being 40, and seeing how they put back the old school mario within the new is so COOL. the whole game play is something i have been missing for a long time. Easy to play and fun and challenging at the same time. with 40 plus moves you can do, this was the first game in forever that i could pick up all the moves within a cpl days and remember them. I have been playing this non stop since i got it, with a day break. you will not be disappointed with this.
customer_reviews.author: Ryi

customer_reviews.title: Fake game
customer_reviews.text: This seller gave me the Goosebumps game in a Mario jacket. The sticker had obviously been peeled off. The Mario game is great. This seller is crap. Seriously not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Flat out wonderful.
customer_reviews.text: Easily one of the best games of the year, contender for Game of the Year awards along with Breath of the Wild. The music is wonderful and the gameplay is superb, I recommend a pro controller to get the best out of controlling Mario through the many obstacles in the game. If you have a Switch you just HAVE to get this game.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: Great fun game, I’m a huge Nintendo fan but not so good at games with a bunch of monsters, this game was the perfect balance of difficulty for me to be able to pass things not easily but it wasn’t impossible, tons of things to explore and collect and all the little outfits he can change into are cute, definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: but definitely worth the effort in my opinion if you like 100% games
customer_reviews.text: Not normally a fan of collection games but a big fan of puzzle and platformers and of Mario. The game packed a lot more in than I realized and was short enough that I was not fatigued. I did not go back and find all the missing moons, but definitely worth the effort in my opinion if you like 100% games.
customer_reviews.author: JGalarza

customer_reviews.title: King of the Franchise
customer_reviews.text: Great game and probably the best if the franchise in my opinion. Has something for everyone, no matter what age group you fall into. One of Nintendo's greatest games to date !
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Well, do it.
customer_reviews.text: I would buy this 1000 times over. I was a big fan of Mario on the NES through N64, but fell away after Sunshine, which in my teenage years, I perceived as weirdly preachy (I love the environment, but do we need a Mario where his main attack is to clean it...but I have since come around totalling a shine to Sunshine). Anywho, the soundtrack is divine and the gameplay is spot on. A true successor to Mario 64.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew A. Marsh

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: Looks to me like a fun game but my 13yr old nephew was just like meh. I think he just finally graduated into using his Xbox one to play online with his friends. I don’t know the obsession with these multiplayer games to kill each other. In Mario odyssey I liked the free roaming and figuring out how to get past areas and items. I would like it if I had a switch. Too bad they don’t make these for Xbox. I’d buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Doombious

customer_reviews.title: Amazing game. The controls feel really good and it ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing game. The controls feel really good and it does a great job of incorporating the joycons and motion controls without being annoying. The story is good, but nothing insanely unique for Mario. The game does seem extremely easy, but there is plenty of replay value as there are hundreds of power moons to find, many of which are not easy to find. The graphics and the characters are also pretty nice and the kingdoms are beautifully created, with a few exceptions. Overall, this is an amazing game and is maybe even comparable to Breath of The Wild.
customer_reviews.author: TheGuyWhoReviews

customer_reviews.title: #1 Reason to Own a Switch
customer_reviews.text: Zelda is a great game, but this is the best reason for owning a Switch. I first started playing on th TV and the game is beautiful. I thought it would lose something on the handheld but was very pleasantly surprised that it didn't. Easy enough to keep me from wanting to throw the Switch through the window, but challenging enough to keep you from becoming bored. I always worry when I pre-order a game, but this one was well worth the risk (glad I didn't pre-order Gran Tourismo Sport!). Buy it, it's awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick R

product_meta.title: Super Mario Odyssey - Nintendo Switch
product_meta.description:
Embark on a cap-tivating, globe-trotting adventure!

Join Mario on a massive, globe-trotting 3D adventure and use his incredible new abilities to collect Moons so you can power up your airship, the Odyssey, and rescue Princess Peach from Bowser's wedding plans! This sandbox-style 3D Mario adventure—the first since 1996's beloved Super Mario 64 and 2002's Nintendo GameCube classic Super Mario Sunshine—is packed with secrets and surprises, and with Mario's new moves like cap throw, cap jump, and capture, you'll have fun and exciting gameplay experiences unlike anything you've enjoyed in a Mario game before. Get ready to be whisked away to strange and amazing places far from the Mushroom Kingdom!

System Requirements: Supported Platforms: Nintendo - Switch
Nintendo account required for game activation and installation​
feature_bullets: Explore 3D kingdoms filled with secrets and surprises, including costumes for Mario and several ways to interact with environments
Mario's new friend, Cappy, lets you master new moves like cap throw, cap jump and capture

Visit astonishing new locales, such as the skyscraper-packed New Donk City, and run into familiar friends and foes as you try to save Princess Peach from Bowser's clutches and foil his dastardly wedding plans
Hand a Joy-Con controller to a friend to enjoy simultaneous multiplayer: Player 1 controls Mario while Player 2 controls Mario’s new ally Cappy
Unlock even more features with the exclusive new amiibo figures - Mario, Princess Peach and Bowser dressed in their wedding outfits

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars7,390 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
specifications.Pricing: The strikethrough price is the List Price. Savings represents a discount off the List Price.
